snippet: Doctors at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center plan to treat trauma patients with an experimental procedure that induces hypothermia in dying patients to buy them more time.
abstract: Researchers at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center have begun clinical trial in which they induce clinical death in severe trauma patients by inducing hypothermia and slowing metabolism in order to buy surgeons more time to operate; patients would then be revived later; some are questioning ethics of procedure, which has never been tried in humans, in part because unconscious patients will not be able to give consent.
lead_paragraph: Doctors at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center plan to treat trauma patients with an experimental procedure that induces hypothermia in dying patients to buy them more time.

headline.main: Killing a Patient to Save His Life
